content: hi @Ally Shaban @Richard Stanley based on previous discussion started to document the ihris relationship as an IG https://openhie.github.io/ihris-relationship I put it under OpenHIE as I can't access IntraHealth's repo
@Ryan Crichton @Laura Vignoli this is in relationship to our discussion on fhir2es
how difficult would it be to pull out the iHRIS 5 reporting engine as a standalone @Ally Shaban ? flagging for @Luke Duncan as well.
Technically, the relationship and fhir2es is all you really need. Once you have that, you have the data in Elasticsearch and you can build reports in kibana.
thanks @Luke Duncan - i was thinking of the tabular report pages. @Ally Shaban demo'ed a little while ago and that would be great to pull out for inclusion in our analytics stack.
You can do tabular reports in Kibana, maybe not quite as nice, but they don't require anything external.

but Kibana wouldn't know about the extra metadata defined in the ihris-relationship. it looks like the bulk of the ihris reports start here https://github.com/iHRIS/iHRIS/blob/9bb438bd6b83d91eacefc52fc64fbfc95ac3463d/ihris-backend/routes/config.js#L977
Yes @Carl Leitner Kibana cant read those metadata
